issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: This will put more pressure on the HDFS file limit.
fields.summary: Bootstrap repl is not cleaning up staging dirs

comments.body:
Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:

This message is automatically generated.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12886282 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
Test result looks good. [~daijy] Can you please take a look?

I see you add staging dirs into the fsScratchDirs, but when Hive actually remove the fsScratchDirs? After all task finishes? Is it afterall the table/partition load task this ReplLoadTask adds. Also can you add a check to one of the test case in TestReplicationScenarios?
[~daijy] The cleanup happens when the SQLOperation is done and the context is being closed. Will see if I can add a test.

Ok, you mean after the "repl load" sql commands finishes, right? That makes sense. However, I feel PathUtils is a bad name, it is not a utility class with static methods, it has states. Would it be better to change it to ReplStagingDirs?
[~daijy] I agree that PathUtils should not contain state but should be a pure util class. However that's more of refactor work. Can we move that task to a separate jira?
Sure

[~daijy] See "HIVE-17496.2.patch" for the added unit test.

cc [~thejas]

ATTACHMENT ID: 12886553 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
Uploaded "HIVE-17496.3.patch" to fix test issue.
+1 pending tests. Tao confirm that driverMirror.close won't cause issue for followup tests as it only close the current statement.
